page.title: 12THE GREAT CHALK PIT
page.content: The Chalk Pit is near the A32, Alton, Reading road. It one of the deepest chalk pits in the South of England. It is used, mainly as a small-holding, covering about seven and three quarter acres of land. It was last used to dig chalk, for liming the fields, in 1939, when a mechanical digger was used for the first time. The sides of the pit are seventy feet high. A great deal of local history is centered around the Great Chalk Pit. In West Street, an office in a private house belongs to the local undertaker. The Red Cross Centre,near the A32 road, is used as a hall to entertain elderly poeple. Wheel-chairs and aids for the disabled are stored there. The Recreation Ground has a football pitch and swings There are two tennis courts, one is privately owned. At The Crown, public house, there is a bus stop.
